title: Steel Rods
question_text:
A company manufacturing steel rods makes rods that have a mean diameter of $0.5\text{ inches}$ and standard deviation of $0.03\text{ inches}$ and are approximately normally distributed.
The company will accept all rods unless they are in the thinnest $1\%$ or thickest $1\%$ of all those manufactured.
What is the range of diameters that will be acceptable to the manufacturer?

choices.text: Unable to determine based off of the information given.

solution:
Use the standard normal table to determine the first percentile is $2.33$ standard deviations below the mean.

To find the thinnest, solve the following equation:

$$-2.33 =\dfrac{ (x-0.5)}{0.03}$$

$$x = 0.43$$

Use the standard normal table to determine the $99^\text{th}$ percentile is $2.33$ standard deviations above the mean.

To find the thickest, solve the following equation:

$$2.33 =\dfrac{ (x-0.5)}{0.03}$$

$$x = 0.57$$

Thus, the range is $0.43$ to $0.57$.

Therefore, the correct answer is Choice 'D'.
